summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between an FBI Special Agent and attorney Brittany Henderson, coordinating interviews with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves scheduling discussions and references the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC corresponding with an FBI Special Agent to schedule interviews with Epstein victims on behalf of her clients.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC copied on the email chain discussing victim interviews with the FBI.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, likely a colleague at Edwards Pottinger LLC involved in the Epstein victim case coordination.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC working on the Epstein victim case, as evidenced by being copied on the same correspondence.
Both are associated with Edwards Pottinger LLC and copied on the email chain regarding victim interviews.
Attorney coordinating with an FBI Special Agent to schedule interviews for Epstein victims, indicating a legal-investigative relationship.

events.title: Proposed victim interview date
events.description: Brittany Henderson initially proposed Monday, June 29, 2020, for the FBI Special Agent to speak with victims.

events.title: Scheduling coordination for victim interviews
events.description: Email exchange finalizing scheduling for victim interviews between Edwards Pottinger LLC attorneys and the FBI.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit in New York was actively interviewing Epstein victims as of June-July 2020.
The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC represented multiple Epstein victims and was coordinating their interviews with the FBI.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein years after his death, focusing on victim testimony.
The email chain references a request for "302's or another form of verification" that a victim had been interviewed by the FBI.
